articles.author: Malorye Branca
articles.title: Ethnicity Affects Cancer Risk from Smoking, Epigenetics Shows - Inside Precision Medicine
articles.description: African Americans and Latinos who smoke can develop specific epigenetic changes putting them particularly at risk for cancer. according to one of the largest multiethnic studies yet of smoking’s influence on cancer risk.
articles.content: African Americans and Latinos who smoke can develop specific epigenetic changes putting them particularly at risk for cancer says research that comes from one of the largest multiethnic studies yet o… [+3315 chars]
